column4: hey I have two ethernet interfaces connected and when I bridge them I cant connect to the internet. can anyone help?
you want to build up a router?
that's the same in that case
you have to set iptables
can you connect to the internet?
ok. great! congratulations!
when i worked on that it took me hours to get that far
let me think a moment. I did so a couple of weeks ago.
you mean, you can connect from firewall to client or what?
you mean a ping? or a connection? what kind of connection?
thats funny
you got an iptables-script somewhere?
what did you use to set up the bridge?
mhmhm...
whats your interfaces file look like? something like ppp0 <blabla> eth0 <blabla> eth1 ...?
goto console
did you say router?
here is mine: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/6625
what kind of connection do you have? dsl?
as far as i know (that's the way mine works): you establish a connection via the ppp0 interface (which actually is a "virtual" interface)
where are you from?
goto console and look at this: less /etc/ppp/chap-secrets
and tell me if there is something like your dsl-username and password in it
